Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: BIT INTERVAL OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identification number for eachinterval in which a bit is used in the wellbore.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: AVERAGE FORCE ON BIT: Weight or force of the drill string that is loaded on the bit,rather than suspended from the derrick.
Column Comment.5: AVERAGE FORCE ON BIT ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit ofmeasure of the average force on the bit.
Column Comment.6: AVERAGE PENETRATION RATE: Penetration rate for bit run. Calculated by dividingtotal distance drilled by total hours run.
Column Comment.8: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.9: BIT DRILLED RATE: Value for the average speed or rotation of the bit (normallyreported in revolutions per minute RPM).
Column Comment.10: BIT DRILLED RATE OUOM: Bit rate original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: BIT JET COUNT: Number of jets installed in the bit. Can be calculated from WELLDRILL BIT JET if you wish.
Column Comment.12: BIT JET REMARK: narrative remarks about the bit jets, if desired. Note that WELLDRILL BIT JET may also be used.
Column Comment.13: BIT NUMBER: The number or identifier for the bit that is used.
Column Comment.14: BIT OPERATING TIME: The bit operating interval time which defines the total timethe drilling bit was operating for the bit run.
Column Comment.15: BIT OPERATING TIME ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.16: BIT REMARK: Remarks pertaining to the drilling bit operation.
Column Comment.17: BIT SIZE: Value for the diameter (width) of the drilling bit.
Column Comment.18: BIT SIZE DESCRIPTION: Narrative comments on the bit size.
Column Comment.19: BIT SIZE OUOM: Bit size/diameter original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: CUTTING STRUCTURE LOCATION: from the IADC Roller Bit Dull Grading locationof cracked or dragged cones. A All Rows H Heel Rows M Middle Rows N NoseRows.
Column Comment.21: BIT CUTTING STRUCTURE MAJOR DULL CHARACTERISTIC: IADC Roller Bit DullGrading major dull characteristics of bit such as BC Broken Cone, LN Lost Nozzle,BT Broken teeth/cutters, LT Lost Teeth/Cutters, BU Balled Up, NO NoMajor/OtherDull Characteristics, CC Cracked Cone (show cone numbers under location), etc.
Column Comment.22: DRILL BIT CUTTING STRUCTURE INNER: IADC Roller Bit Dull Grading - inner 2/3of bit cutting structure tooth condition. Valid values 0-8 in the IADC Standard.
Column Comment.23: DRILL BIT CUTTING STRUCTURE OUTER: the condition of the outer 1/2 of thetooth, derived from the IADC Roller Bit Dull Grading - outer 1/3 of bit cutting structuretooth condition. Valid values 0-8 in the IADC Standard.
Column Comment.24: DISTANCE or FOOTAGE DRILLED: Measured length of the section the bit drilled.(feet or meters)
Column Comment.25: FOOTAGE BIT DRILLED OUOM: Length the bit drilled original unit of measure.
Column Comment.26: DRILLING BIT TYPE: This reference table identifies the type of drilli ng bit used todrill the wellbore segment.
Column Comment.27: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.28: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.29: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.30: FLOW RATE: Flow rate of drilling fluid through the bit, often measured in gallons perminute. Pump strokes per min and pump liner size are used to calculate the flow rate.
Column Comment.32: GAGE OUT DISTANCE: Measured distance that bit is under/out of gage whenpulled. Value of 0.
Column Comment.33: GAGE OUT UOM: Optional. Unit of Measure used for Bit Gage. Current CAODCstandard is mm (millimetre).
Column Comment.34: MAXIMUM FORCE ON BIT: Value for the greatest amount of force applied to the bitduring the drilling operation (higher bit weight carried).
Column Comment.35: MAXIMUM BIT WEIGHT OUOM: Higher bit weight original unit of measure.
Column Comment.36: MAXIMUM PENETRATION RATE: the maximum penetration rate of the bit in thisinterval.
Column Comment.38: MINIMUM BIT WEIGHT: Value for the least amount of force applied to the bit duringthe drilling operation (lower bit weight carried).
Column Comment.39: MINIMUM BIT WEIGHT OUOM: Lower bit weight original unit of measure.
Column Comment.40: MINIMUM PENETRATION RATE: the minimum penetration rate recorded during thisinterval.
Column Comment.42: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL shouldbe created.
Column Comment.43: DRILL BIT REASON PULLED: IADC Roller Bit Dull Grading - reason dull bit pulledsuch as BHA CHG Bottom Hole Assembly, LOG Run Logs, CD Condition Mud PPPump Pressure, CP Core Point, PR Penetration Rate.
Column Comment.44: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.45: REPORTED TOTAL FLUID AREA: The total fluid area of the drilling bit, calculated byadding together the area of each of the jets. Can be calculated.
Column Comment.47: BIT RUN IN DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the point of the drilling bitactivity.
Column Comment.48: BIT RUN IN DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE
Column Comment.49: BIT RUN OUT DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the point of the drillingbit activity.
Column Comment.50: BIT RUN OUT DEPTH OUOM: Bit depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.51: TORQUE: The rotary torque on the bit, usually measured as kilofeet pounds.
Column Comment.53: TOTAL BIT REVOLUTIONS: The total number of revolutions by the bit in thisinterval.
Column Comment.54: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.55: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.56: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.57: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.58: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.59: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.60: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
